pages.text: There are many different gun types in Terramity.$(br2)The guns in Terramity vary a lot in their function and purpose. They range from miniguns, shotguns, and even railguns.
Handguns in Terramity usually have a lot of ammo per magazine, deal solid damage, and sometimes can be one-handed, allowing for use of a melee weapon and a gun at the same time.
Semi-Automatic Rifles in Terramity have long range, fire at a decent rate, and deal solid damage.
Sniper rifles in Terramity have incredibly long range, low bullet drop, deal high damage, but are sometimes costly on ammunition and take a while to reload.
Automatic guns in Terramity have solid range and deal tons of damage, but may be inaccurate and/or expensive to fire.
Shotguns in Terramity are very powerful, deal loads of knockback, but have poor range.

Railguns in Terramity are extraordinarily powerful, are hitscan, and don't use any ammunition. Railguns use a cooldown system unlike regular guns, so having one on hand at all times in case of emergency may be a good idea.
Rocket launchers in Terramity are good for destruction and clearing out large waves of enemies at once when you aren't concerned about the terrain you're firing at.
There are some guns that may not fall into any specific category, but still function as guns.
